block.p: Spouses and kids who are more familiar with the Internet than the waffle iron can still serve up breakfast in bed next Sunday morning. With a couple clicks of the mouse, Urbanfetch will deliver Breakfast-in-a-Bag ($100) -- a half-dozen H&H East bagels, lox and cream cheese, four Fresh Samantha juices and a newspaper, all in a chic straw tote by the designer Annabel Ingall -- in less than an hour. For $75 more, Urbanfetch (at www.urbanfetch.com) has a gift certificate for Avalon Professional Nanny Service, so Mom can eat in peace.
